item.description:
Are you worried about how your body may change as you get older? Turns out you’re not alone. Market size numbers in preventive care range from USD 8.5 billion to over USD 14 billion worldwide.

REGISTER: http://www.mitforumcambridge.org/events/nfc-circle-event-how-nfc-will-keep-us-fit/

And those numbers are likely to swell — thanks to NFC-enabled smartphones. With an NFC chip in your smartphone you could be a lot more “dialed in” to the health impact your lifestyle choices are having. That value proposition should appeal to the world’s billion-plus smartphone users — all of whom are getting older.

It is certainly attracting a lot of interest from software companies, healthcare providers and insurers looking to apply NFC in preventive healthcare — as we’ll hear from the May 20th panel.

MODERATOR: Dr. Kamal Jethwani , Center for Connected Health, Partners Healthcare. Kamal currently leads the research and program evaluation initiatives at the Center for Connected Health. His research is focused on technology-based models of health delivery and use behavior change as a tool for preventive and supportive care in a tertiary health care setting.

SPEAKERS:
Michael Davies, Chairman, Endeavour Partners, a strategy consulting firm with deep expertise in mobile and digital businesses and technologies

Robert Havasy, Senior Technical Lead, Center for Connected Health, Partners Healthcare, and Continua Board Member. Robert is responsible for charting the Center’s technology strategy and constructing the Center’s next-generation Connected Health platform.

Dr Adam Landman, Emergency Physician and Director of Clinical Informatics, Instructor, Harvard Medical School

Ryan Norris, Vice President of Technology, Medullan, a software and services company focused on enabling clients to innovate in an ever changing healthcare industry by providing a 1-stop shop for consistent delivery, sophisticated design and technology.
